I stayed right as Spring was about to start, so I could not take advantage of the in-ground swimming pool, but I look forward to a return stay during warmer weather so I can enjoy the spacious back yard with the pool and the hot tub. I was also traveling alone and for business, so swimming wasn't really on my agenda. But I do foresee a return with my family sometime soon. I usually would not consider Grand Island a vacation spot, but in all seriousness, I think my family would love a couple of nights of relaxation so close to home since the experience would feel so far away. I would recommend Craig & Kimberly's oasis to everyone.

People are INCREDIBLY WONDERFUL in Grand Island!!! We met so many wonderful people! Great antiques, great restaurants, fun speakeasy, sculptures, art…even played some pickle ball, and found a geo cache.
Who would’ve thought this little town had SO MUCH to offer and everyone had so much pride in where they are living…our hearts are filled.
Thanks Grand Island! We’ll be back!

This is a very nice looking house in a very nice neighborhood. Even the lawn looked perfect. It was recently completely remodeled inside and was done very well. Everything looked new.
Pretty much all you would need to stay here other than food is provided. And there is a small table in the kitchen with a basket of breakfast bars, oatmeal, coffees and hot cocoa.
The AC can freeze you out inside if you choose, even though it was around 90 outside while we were here. The WiFi worked great and was sufficiently fast for streaming, games, or Netflix.
The beds have pillow top mattresses and were amazing to sleep on. And the bathroom has a heated floor if you are staying during the cooler months.
There is a washer/dryer in the basement if you need to do laundry while staying.
We will definitely stay here again if we need a place in Grand Island.

review_text: I stayed here for a month for work by myself and of course its a bit too big for myself (not that its a problem). I believe One family could stay here with ease. The communication was smooth even though it was late notice, which I am thankful, they were able to approve me right away. I stayed during the winter when there was a snow storm and they were nice to hire someone who could plow the snow off as I couldnt do it cause of work. You can adjust the heating of course and as to what everyone says, the bathroom floor is heated! I always stay in the bathroom a bit longer than usual just cause of this and the design is just warm and cozy in there. Of course we are in the middle of a pandemic and cleanliness is important. This place was very clean when I got there and tried to keep it as that even after I left, sanitizers and cleaning materials are readily available and extra things that you did not ask for but need. The basement is where they have the laundry and dryer that you could use and it is very easy to learn. The neighborhood is pretty quiet and you get to have a parking space just make sure you park at the right one. Also, I love how the doors have passcode so you dont have to carry a key around to get in. Trash collection is every tuesday morning unless it changes. They have an antique piano that I loved very much and I miss it already. Overall, I felt safe, warm and cozy staying here, definitely would book again. Thank you so much for letting me stay. :)
